sentences.english: This was my first picture-book, and I was entranced by it.
sentences.chinese: 这是我第一本图画书，它让我深深着迷。

sentences.english: Spanish unemployment soared, and the budget went into deep deficit.
sentences.chinese: 西班牙失业率飞速上升，预算陷入深深的赤字之中。
连父亲都深深地被打动。

sentences.english: I was deeply affected by the news.
Please accept our company's  deep apology for this.
sentences.chinese: 请接受敝公司对此事所造成之不便的深深歉意。

sentences.english: You wake me up, from profound coma and aimlessness.
sentences.chinese: 是你，将我从深深的混沌与迷惘中唤醒。

sentences.english: What she done hurt my heart deeply.
sentences.chinese: 她的行为深深地刺痛了我的心。

sentences.english: So I took a deep breath and worked on the last nail.
sentences.chinese: 我深深地吸了口气，去拔最后一根钉子。

sentences.english: Then I sigh, deeply, and sit back into my chair.
sentences.chinese: 接着，我深深叹气，坐回到我的椅子上。

sentences.english: I noticed, behind the neutrality of his gaze, a deep weariness.
sentences.chinese: 我注意到他不露声色的注视背后藏着深深的厌倦。

sentences.english: I can recollect many things which I did not understand, but which stirred me deeply.
sentences.chinese: 我能记起许多我不能理解但却使我深深激动的事情。

sentences.english: Poured out of a deep gully of red light at my face you wantonly spread.
sentences.chinese: 冲涌出的沟壑深深浅浅的在你我的脸上肆意漫延。

sentences.english: Rescorla implicitly understood that he could turn office workers into survivors.
sentences.chinese: 瑞斯寇拉深深了解他可以将办公室员工变成存活者。

sentences.english: Feel your feet root into the ground beneath you.
sentences.chinese: 感觉你的脚深深的扎根进地面里。

sentences.english: I wrote that down after I read it. It struck me as something important.
sentences.chinese: 读完这几句，我就把它们抄下了，并深深地为之震撼。

sentences.english: The scene photographed itself on my mind.
sentences.chinese: 这个景象深深地印在我的脑海中。

definition: to brand (cattle etc)/brand/(fig.) to leave a lasting mark/to stigmatize/mark/stamp/stigma
in the depth of one's soul
arising involuntarily (idiom); spontaneous/to spring up unbidden (of emotion)
central point/in one's thoughts/in one's heart
to touch/to stir up (trouble or emotions)/to move (sb's emotions or worry)
to miss/to long for/to remember with longing/yearning
to be full of (emotion)/to brim with (love, tears etc)
